generated_body: The article titled "Judge calls USC dad a 'thief,' gives longest prison sentence so far in college admissions scandal" likely discusses the recent developments in the high-profile college admissions scandal, focusing on the sentencing of a father involved in the case. Readers can expect an overview of the judge's comments, particularly the characterization of the defendant as a "thief," which may reflect the legal and ethical implications of the scandal. The piece could also detail the length of the prison sentence and provide context on how this case fits into the broader narrative of the admissions scandal, highlighting the ongoing repercussions for those involved.
